column2: Geld und ist eine perfekte Geschenkidee. Wir wirtschaften auch nachhaltig, verleihen nur Kleidung mit den derzeit anspruchsvollsten Textil-Zertifizierungen. D.h. sie wurde nachhaltig und fair produziert.

column1: Die mehrfache Nutzung der Babykleidung schont zusätzlich Ressourcen. Wir nutzen Ökostrom, waschen mit Öko-Waschmittel und versenden CO2-neutral DHL GoGreen – in Recyclingkartons, versteht sich.
Dazu sieht alles noch hübsch aus, denn Kartoffelsack-Öko war gestern. Also viele gute Gründe, uns zu unterstützen.

Und wir möchten weder einen Kredit aufnehmen, noch Investoren an Bord holen, denen wir zu einem viel zu frühen Zeitpunkt vage Versprechen über potentielle Rendite machen müssten und die dann auch einen – berechtigten – Mitspracheanspruch erheben würden.

Cottonbudbaby soll erstmal unser Baby bleiben und wir brauchen nur eine kleine, freundschaftliche Starthilfe. Deswegen wollen wir mit dieser Crowdfunding-Kampagne Euch als Paten gewinnen und hoffen, unsere Dankeschöns bereiten Euch Freude, während Ihr unserem Baby beim Wachsen zuseht.
<span style=""font-size: 2em

<a href=""http://www.thermo-tex.de/html/artikelstamm/funkscanner.html?&amp

column1: Und wir möchten zunächst das Wäschewaschen selbst übernehmen, da wir bislang noch keine Großwäscherei als potentiellen Partner gefunden haben, die unseren ökologischen Ansprüchen genügt. Deswegen müssen wir in eine professionelle Waschmaschine investieren. Bspw. so eine
Profi-Waschmaschine

Außerdem würden wir gerne bis Anfang des Jahres 2015 unsere Webseite weiter professionell ausbauen. Da unsere IT-Abteilung im Moment aus einem Menschen besteht, könnte das schwierig werden. Wir möchten gerne für gezielte Unterstützung Geld ausgeben.
Mit 10.000 Euro können wir alle diese Ziele gut erreichen. Aber auch mit weniger ist uns natürlich schon sehr geholfen.

Das geht natürlich auch! Sprecht über uns, leitet unsere Mails weiter, macht auf die Kampagne in Euren sozialen Netzwerken aufmerksam. Und erzählt allen, die ein Baby erwarten, von Cottonbudbaby.
","Um den Film zu sehen, bitte oben auf das Bild klicken!
Wer sind wir?
Wir sind die frische-Eltern-Sorgen-Linderer: Welche Kleidung brauche ich für mein Baby? Welcher Qualität kann ich vertrauen? Wie viel Geld muss ich ausgeben? Wo kaufe ich ein?
Cottonbudbaby ist ein Baby-Erstausstattungsverleih. Ca. 16 Kleidungsstücke, alles, was das Baby am Anfang braucht, schicken wir den Müttern und Vätern in der Cottonbudbaby-Box nach Hause.
Die Kleidung ist
hochwertig bio-zertifiziert & auch noch
hübsch.
Wächst das Baby aus der ersten Größe heraus, schicken wir den Familien die Cottonbudbaby-Box mit der nächsten Größe zu

. Die Box mit der rausgewachsenen Kleidung bekommen wir dann zurückgeschickt. Und das bis zu sechs Monate lang. Das Baby ist also immer perfekt angezogen - ohne schmerzhafte Kompromisse zwischen Qualität und Preis machen zu müssen. Und ohne Einkaufs- und Organisationsstress

für die Eltern. Die haben dann nämlich Zeit, für das, was wirklich wichtig ist: Ihr Kind. Damit wir diese nachhaltige Idee zur Ressourcen-Schonung möglichst schnell umsetzen können, brauchen wir Finanzierungshilfe. Also: Spread the word!
Warum leihen und nicht gleich nachhaltig produzierte Kleidung kaufen?
Jährlich werden in Deutschland rund 400.000 Tonnen Textilien in den Müll geworfen, rund 500.000 Tonnen gehen in die Altkleidersammlungen. Rund 15% sind fast neuwertig, wurden nie oder kaum getragen.

Kleidung mehrfach zu nutzen leistet einen wichtigen Beitrag, die ökologische Belastung zu reduzieren. Säuglinge bewegen sich kaum und verschmutzen ihre Kleidung nicht. Ihre Kleidung ist also so gut wie neu, wenn die Kleinen aus ihr rausgewachsen sind. Diese Kleidungsstücke mehrfach zu nutzen, schont die Umwelt und ist kostensparend für junge Familien.

Durch die Zertifizierung der verliehenen Kleidungsstücke mit GOTS oder IVN Best, beides Zertifikate mit dem derzeit höchstmöglichen Anspruch an die gesamte Produktionskette, ist zudem ein wichtiger Beitrag zur Förderung nachhaltiger Produktionsbedingungen im Textilbereich geleistet.
Warum solltet Ihr uns unterstützen?

Ihr helft uns, damit wir Müttern und Vätern helfen können, die Welt zu verbessern. Cottonbudbaby spart frischgebackenen Eltern nicht nur Zeit & Geld und ist eine perfekte Geschenkidee. Wir wirtschaften auch nachhaltig, verleihen nur Kleidung mit den derzeit anspruchsvollsten Textil-Zertifizierungen. D.h. sie wurde nachhaltig und fair produziert.
Die mehrfache Nutzung der Babykleidung schont zusätzlich Ressourcen. Wir nutzen Ökostrom, waschen mit Öko-Waschmittel und versenden CO2-neutral DHL GoGreen – in Recyclingkartons, versteht sich.
Dazu sieht alles noch hübsch aus, denn Kartoffelsack-Öko war gestern. Also viele gute Gründe, uns zu unterstützen.

Und wir möchten weder einen Kredit aufnehmen, noch Investoren an Bord holen, denen wir zu einem viel zu frühen Zeitpunkt vage Versprechen über potentielle Rendite machen müssten und die dann auch einen – berechtigten – Mitspracheanspruch erheben würden.

Cottonbudbaby soll erstmal unser Baby bleiben und wir brauchen nur eine kleine, freundschaftliche Starthilfe. Deswegen wollen wir mit dieser Crowdfunding-Kampagne Euch als Paten gewinnen und hoffen, unsere Dankeschöns bereiten Euch Freude, während Ihr unserem Baby beim Wachsen zuseht.
Was passiert konkret mit dem Geld?

Wir brauchen wegen der relativ komplexen Logistik hinter unserem Verleihsystem ein vernünftiges Warenlogistik-System. Dafür müssen wir in Soft- und Hardware (u.a. ein Scanner für unsere Kleiderlabel, bspw. so ein
Funkscanner) investieren. Um Software und Scanner optimal nutzen zu können, brauchen wir beispielsweise so ein Windows-Laptop

Und wir möchten zunächst das Wäschewaschen selbst übernehmen, da wir bislang noch keine Großwäscherei als potentiellen Partner gefunden haben, die unseren ökologischen Ansprüchen genügt. Deswegen müssen wir in eine professionelle Waschmaschine investieren. Bspw. so eine
Profi-Waschmaschine

Außerdem würden wir gerne bis Anfang des Jahres 2015 unsere Webseite weiter professionell ausbauen. Da unsere IT-Abteilung im Moment aus einem Menschen besteht, könnte das schwierig werden. Wir möchten gerne für gezielte Unterstützung Geld ausgeben.
Mit 10.000 Euro können wir alle diese Ziele gut erreichen. Aber auch mit weniger ist uns natürlich schon sehr geholfen.
Wer macht Cottonbudbaby?
Severine

hat viele Jahre als Journalistin gearbeitet und sich u.a. als Autorin für Sustainability-Reports intensiv mit Nachhaltigkeitsfragen beschäftigt. Als Mutter hat sie schnell gemerkt, wie viel Zeit & Energie sie für die Suche nach schöner, ökologisch vertretbarer und bezahlbarer Kleidung aufwenden muss – die dann nach 3 Wochen oft schon wieder zu klein war. Cottonbudbaby ist die logische Konsequenz aus ihrer Expertise und Erfahrung.
Jason hat viele Jahre internationale Erfahrung als Entwickler und Berater. Cottonbudbaby kann unter seiner Aufsicht gesund wachsen, ohne Flausen im Kopf.
Emma ist Severines und Jasons Tochter und ist für Ablenkung und Inspiration verantwortlich.

Außerdem haben alle Drei inzwischen ein großes Netzwerk an Unterstützern gewonnen. Freundinnen und Freunde aus der Modebranche, aus dem IT-Bereich, Unternehmensberater & Produktmanagerinnen, Fotografinnen, Filmemacher, Werbeprofis, PR-Talente und viele Eltern, die einfach an die Genialität der Idee glauben. Cottonbudbaby kann also bereits auf einen kleinen Schwarm Unterstützer bauen – nun brauchen wir noch Euch, um die Welt zu retten
Knapp bei Kasse, aber trotzdem helfen?

Das geht natürlich auch! Sprecht über uns, leitet unsere Mails weiter, macht auf die Kampagne in Euren sozialen Netzwerken aufmerksam. Und erzählt allen, die ein Baby erwarten, von Cottonbudbaby.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

Wake up to the sound of rushing water and calling birds. A breath of crisp mountain air fills your lungs and filtered sunlight trickles across your eyelids. You pull the still warm sleeping bag around you, nestling in as your body adjusts from a deep and restful sleep. The lulling voices of your fellow campers come into focus, and the rich smell of sizzling bacon and eggs wafts in through the tent flap. You pull yourself out of your tent and know that this is going to be an amazing day, one of the best days of your life. This is what we offer at the Columbia Gorge Teen Camps: An experience that will last a lifetime! We strive to enrich and challenge motivated teens in a safe and supportive outdoor environment. Our camps offer specialized instruction in rock climbing, photography, music, martial arts and paddle sports from professionals and world class experts. We foster growth in character, personal sense of independence, self-worth and self-confidence. Each day our campers are pushed to be the best they can be, and given the opportunity to express themselves in the areas that make them special.
<div class=""template asset"">
Campers from the 2012 season.
A little more about our camp:

Motivated teens will spend 10 days in one of the most spectacular natural wonders in the U.S.A., in one of the following specialty camps: Music Discovery, Photography, Rock Climbing, Paddle Sports or Martial Arts. Our base camp is located in Lyle, Washington, a stone throw from the majestic Columbia Gorge River. We are a co-ed camp and cater to all teens ages 14-17, who have a desire to improve themselves and the world around them, while having the time of their lives.

We are in our second year of operation and are looking for funding to send four or more exceptional teens to camp this year. Normal tuition for our camps ranges from $1950 to $2,150 and for some this will prevent them from signing up. This project will help our campers reach that financial goal, and ensure them an unforgettable summer adventure. For our campers this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to pursue their passions, connect with like-minded peers and learn from remarkable instructors and counselors who are tops in their field. Last year we gave financial support to 20 deserving teens, allowing them to take part in one of our 10 day camps. This year, with help from the community we hope to do the same or better. 100% of the money raised will go towards sending aspiring teenagers to the Columbia Gorge Camps for the summer. This means all funds will be directly applied to camper tuition, not spent on miscellaneous expenses. Through this assistance, deserving teens will have a chance to create lasting impressions, and our camp will continue to grow as a catalyst for nurturing passions and dreams.
Location

Our teen camp is located in The Columbia River Gorge, which borders Oregon and Washington. This magnificent area is truly one of North America's most stunning natural wonders. Our base camp hugs the edge of the Columbia River. The Gorge is home to world class water sports, climbing, cycling, hiking, flora and fauna and natural beauty not found anywhere else in the world. Since its discovery the Gorge has been an inspiration to artists, a destination for outdoor/sports enthusiasts and a breeding ground for amazing people. We chose this inspirational setting to give our campers the best place to learn, grow and reach the height of their potential.
<div class=""template asset"">
A shot of Mt. Hood from our Photography camp.
Nature is Good for Everyone

Time and again studies have shown that being in nature is vital to health and mental well-being. We want to make sure that this love for the outdoors stays strong in future generations. Children who spend part of their summer vacation at summer camp return to their academic year with new experiences and with revitalized energy, and do better in school. Part of our goal is to maintain a global interest in the outdoors and pass along that connection to our children. The best way of doing this is to cultivate that interest in our youth, and show them that a raging river or a rocky mountain trail is more exhilarating than a video game or late night talk show can ever be.

Campers can choose from five specializations:

Climbing

Campers will receive world class instruction from our amazing camp leaders and celebrity climbers. Rick Harrell will be heading up our 2013 program as our program director, and campers will be accompanied by Lynn Hill (session 1) and Beth Rodden (session 2) our two celebrity climbers, arguably two of the best climbers in the world. For teens who are seriously interested in climbing this is a chance to learn from the best, in one of nature's most splendid natural habitats.
<div class=""template asset"">
Lynn Hill one of our celebrity guest climbers.
Photography

We think the Columbia Gorge is a photographer’s paradise…rivers, waterfalls, fields of wildflowers, snow-covered mountains, ancient forests and blue skies contribute to a perfect setting for nature photography. Active outdoor sports provide the second major theme of the camp. Our campers will take photographs of their fellow campers shooting whitewater rapids in an inflatable raft
column2: hiking to the top of a waterfall for the shot that few others get
column3: and athletes flying past on a sailboard or kite-board. Since getting to that “right” spot may take some physical effort, campers must be in reasonable condition and capable of hiking up to five miles in a day. Our top program directors, Chuck Feil and Craig Hanson are award winning, professional photographers and great teachers. They will take the campers further in their knowledge of photography in ten days than they ever thought possible.

column1: <div class=""template asset"">
Photographers at the 2012 photo camp.
Music

Musicians come one come all! Instrumentalists, singers, songwriters and producers alike, will bring their talents to the table and discover how collaboration can enrich their art! Unlike other genre-specific music camps, the Music Discovery Camp will focus on bringing together teens whose individual interests span a wide range of styles. An open mind and zest for innovation are the key components that will enable teens to make the most of this experience. In addition to honing skills in their specific area of interest, teens will have opportunities to broaden their musical horizons by learning from their peers and studying techniques that will be beneficial to them in a vast array of musical situations. Gifted teachers, Dylan Charles and Ira Nepus will illuminate the journey of this very exciting Music Discovery Camp.
<div class=""template asset"">
Dylan Charles, director of the Music Discovery Camp.
Paddle Sports

This is a new program that we are super excited about. This is a unique opportunity unmatched anywhere. The camp will take advantage of some of the most scenic lakes, rivers and ocean environment that the Pacific northwest of the United States has to offer. After exploring the Columbia Gorge area we will be venturing out to the coast! Our days will be filled with exploring beaches, tide pools, whitewater rafting , kayaking, stand up paddle boarding, overnight canoe trips, surfing and experiencing all the riches this picturesque area has to offer. Our Paddle Sports Camp will be headed up by Terry Kimball and Jo Evers who have vast experience in aquatics and countless credentials in teaching paddle sports and water safety to youth.
<div class=""template asset"">
2012 campers braving the rapids.
Martial Arts

Martial Arts and nature have long been partners for nurturing the body and the mind. Campers will study under world class martial arts masters, without the distractions of daily life. Hikes, physical training and exercises refresh and calm the mind. Teens will return from camp motivated and confident in their abilities. Our integrated martial arts camp involves helping campers become the best they can be in all aspects of their lives. Our martial arts program director, Padme Grace, has countless certifications including Master Life Coach specializing in health and wellness, personal trainer, exercise specialist, nutrition specialist, Shufoksn Karate Sensei certified, 2nd level Chun-Tu Kwan Instructor certified and 3rd degree black Belt Shudokan Karate-do, Alaska Airlines SkySafe Program and is a certified Zumba Gold Fitness instructor. She works with Integrated Martial Arts full time and has over 16 years of impressive experience working with children, teens, and families.
<div class=""template asset"">
Campers hiking in the natural beauty of the Columbia Gorge.
Dr. Robert Hanson

Columbia Gorge Teen Camps was the brain child of Dr. Robert Hanson. Bob is a Professor-Emeritus from the San Diego State University Department of Recreation. His main area of emphasis while at SDSU was Camp Administration and Camp Counseling. Most of his adult life has been devoted to developing and running camp programs for children and youth. He is co-author of two classic books: 'Stories For The Campfire' and 'Camp Program Ideas.' For many years, he served as the Education Chair for the Southern California Section of the American Camp Association. After moving to Northern California Hanson held the same office in the Northern California Section for eight years. He has founded and directed several camps and outdoor programs, some of which are Mountain Camp II, Northwest Wilderness Adventures, Trinity River Rafting Center, Camp Aztec and Camp Able. A past-president of the California Alpine Club, he continues to lead yearly river canoe trips and High Sierra Base Camp trips.
<div class=""template asset"">
Dr. Bob Hanson
Who is this Camp For?

Our camps are for motivated teens, ages 14 to 17, who want to pursue their best in one of our specialties. These camps are not intended to be therapy. Anyone with special needs should look elsewhere. We will not accept any teen who has a problem with authority, uses any form of tobacco, drugs or alcohol, or is subject to rude or disruptive behavior. There are many camps for teens with special needs or behavioral problems, but that’s not us.
<div class=""template asset"">
Climbing campers with celebrity climber Lynn Hill.

Please help our camp to grow and give teens a once in a lifetime opportunity, to create lifelong memories and reach the height of their potential at Columbia Gorge Teen Camps.

The camp will take advantage of some of the most scenic lakes, rivers and ocean environment that the Pacific northwest of the United States has to offer. After exploring the Columbia Gorge area we will be venturing out to the coast! Our days will be filled with exploring beaches, tide pools, whitewater rafting , kayaking, stand up paddle boarding, overnight canoe trips, surfing and experiencing all the riches this picturesque area has to offer. Our Paddle Sports Camp will be headed up by Terry Kimball and Jo Evers who have vast experience in aquatics and countless credentials in teaching paddle sports and water safety to youth.
2012 campers braving the rapids.
Martial Arts

Martial Arts and nature have long been partners for nurturing the body and the mind. Campers will study under world class martial arts masters, without the distractions of daily life. Hikes, physical training and exercises refresh and calm the mind. Teens will return from camp motivated and confident in their abilities. Our integrated martial arts camp involves helping campers become the best they can be in all aspects of their lives. Our martial arts program director, Padme Grace, has countless certifications including Master Life Coach specializing in health and wellness, personal trainer, exercise specialist, nutrition specialist, Shufoksn Karate Sensei certified, 2nd level Chun-Tu Kwan Instructor certified and 3rd degree black Belt Shudokan Karate-do, Alaska Airlines SkySafe Program and is a certified Zumba Gold Fitness instructor. She works with Integrated Martial Arts full time and has over 16 years of impressive experience working with children, teens, and families.
Campers hiking in the natural beauty of the Columbia Gorge.
Dr. Robert Hanson

Columbia Gorge Teen Camps was the brain child of Dr. Robert Hanson. Bob is a Professor-Emeritus from the San Diego State University Department of Recreation. His main area of emphasis while at SDSU was Camp Administration and Camp Counseling. Most of his adult life has been devoted to developing and running camp programs for children and youth. He is co-author of two classic books: 'Stories For The Campfire' and 'Camp Program Ideas.' For many years, he served as the Education Chair for the Southern California Section of the American Camp Association. After moving to Northern California Hanson held the same office in the Northern California Section for eight years. He has founded and directed several camps and outdoor programs, some of which are Mountain Camp II, Northwest Wilderness Adventures, Trinity River Rafting Center, Camp Aztec and Camp Able. A past-president of the California Alpine Club, he continues to lead yearly river canoe trips and High Sierra Base Camp trips.
Dr. Bob Hanson
Who is this Camp For?

Our camps are for motivated teens, ages 14 to 17, who want to pursue their best in one of our specialties. These camps are not intended to be therapy. Anyone with special needs should look elsewhere. We will not accept any teen who has a problem with authority, uses any form of tobacco, drugs or alcohol, or is subject to rude or disruptive behavior. There are many camps for teens with special needs or behavioral problems, but that’s not us.
Climbing campers with celebrity climber Lynn Hill.
Please help our camp to grow and give teens a once in a lifetime opportunity, to create lifelong memories and reach the height of their potential at Columbia Gorge Teen Camps.",9.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Lyle, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/columbia-gorge-teen-camps-the-experience-of-a-lifetime/pica

The Campaign has now ended. A huge thank you to everyone who donated, tweeted, shared and spread the word. We are extremely grateful to you all. Although I haven't raised as much as I'd hoped, the donations will be so gratefully received and more helpful than you could know (unless you've been in a similar position). Sarah x
I would like to help Tina, a professional dog walker &
column2: pet carer who has been kind, helpful, flexible, reliable and supportive to me and all her customers over many years. She has been ill since July with an excruciatingly painful acute patellofemoral pain syndrome. Basically her kneecap is scraping instead of gliding over the lower femur because of a sprained knee ligament and the whole leg is severely restricted by pain. It was all caused by a movement to avoid treading on and hurting a small dog that had run under her foot as she was walking.

column1: Therefore Tina has been unable to work properly for four months and is now in a very bad financial position. Added to the painful knee/leg and the side effects of all the anti-inflammatories, she is now deeply depressed about not being able to pay her bills. This week she has been told the knee/leg may not fully recover because of both osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis. She feels a failure without anyone to turn to for help.

Tina has been a single parent for many years. Her oldest child’s father died and the younger children’s father walked out on them when they were babies and has refused to be part of their lives. They have had some very traumatic situations to deal with over a long period of time and have no extended family to help. So I’m asking if we can support her collectively. If it was the other way around Tina would most definitely help us.

I am going to ask for a relatively small amount as anything would help her out and be so gratefully received. Initially she needs money to pay for utilities and mortgage payments which are now in arrears and at risk of being cut off and the house repossessed. Tina has just discovered that her beloved dog has a tumour and needs an immediate operation to remove it.  She needs urgent dental treatment and her vehicle without which she is unable to work at all also needs a number of critical repairs.

It would be fantastic if you could support Tina in any way at all by either sending a donation and/or spreading the word by telling your friends, sending them the link and also sending links to the campaign out with all your emails and following on Twitter.

I believe that Paypal donations go through to the recipient straight away, so anything sent by that method of payment will have an immediate impact in both financial terms and emotional support. It would be fantastic for Tina to know that people want to help her get out of a deep and dark place. It would make a huge difference.

Long term Tina has debts which have mounted up over the years because her mortgage is far too high (one of those that the banks should never have given) and therefore her income, although she has always worked seven days a week, 52 weeks a year, including all holidays, is usually only enough to cover the basics as a single parent family with nothing left to save for emergencies and extras despite being frugal.
Can you help me to give Tina freedom from debt and financial security?
Please, please help this campaign raise as much as possible and thank you so, so much for donating and spreading the word.

PIPs - Points with Purpose
Truth is, from the coffee you brew in the morning to the way you get to work, or pay your bills, your everyday actions have an impact - on the environment, on community and on you.
With PIPs, you get a little something back for certain decisions. That's right, you get PIPs (Positive Impact Points)  for making meaningful and measurable better choices...
Choices like bike sharing, switching to green energy, shopping responsibly, driving safely, volunteering, donating, micro-investing and a whole lot more.

column4:
>

And the good doesn’t stop there. You see, PIPs is the ONE virtual currency that delivers 360 degrees of good. Not only do you earn PIPs for making good choices, you continue the virtuous cycle when redeeming them for socially beneficial goods and services. This makes our redemption catalog truly special, loaded with cool new gadgets, smart products and services, as well as ways to donate, crowd fund, and invest your PIPs in amazing projects near home and around the world.

Now you understand why some are calling PIPs “the frequent flyer miles for good,” only rather than doubling your miles, PIPs doubles your good.

column1:
PIPs is a WINNER of a BigAppsNYC 2014 prize, the nation’s largest civic innovations competition. PIPs comes on the tech scene at an exciting time, when smart tools can track the most quotidian of behaviors, and game strategies and social media make sharing the good one does fun and rewarding. Our ‘tech-enabled good’ platform is ideally suited for civic engagement - able to recognize, reward and reinforce beneficial behaviors from reducing energy use and recycling to carpooling, bikesharing and avoiding congested parts of town.

This is precisely why we are launching our Indiegogo campaign now. Your contributions will go toward building two exciting new features that will enhance our capacity to capture and reward positive impact behaviors that deliver personal, community and environmental benefit.

Read on to learn more.
<div> <h3>Give &amp
PIPs NEEDS YOUR HELP
We're looking to raise $50,000 through this Campaign so we can:
<ul>
<li>GROW PIPs membership to 25,000
<li>BUILD new product features, specifically an awesome new interface that allows members to connect up with self-tracking and connected home apps and earn PIPs for reaching goals
• LAUNCH a PIPs mobile app so members can geolocate, earn and redeem PIPs in stores, at restaurants, etc.
YOU GET PERKS FOR CONTRIBUTING
Or better yet, You get PIPs - lots and lots of PIPs - that you can spend as you wish on pipsrewards.com.
Impact
PIPs REWARDS POSITIVE IMPACT ACTIONS

PIPs is a trademarked brand of 3P Partners, a benefit corporation in New York State. As such we must consider societal benefits as well as profits. To this end, whereas most rewards programs award consumption, PIPs rewards behaviors that deliver positive impact  across at least one of three areas - Environment, Community and Mind &

A wide range of actions will be considered, from donating to a charity to participating in the sharing economy, joining in a crowdfunding project or purchasing smart products or services, like a Honeywell Smart Thermostat or responsibly sourced products from Zady.com.

The primary constraints we put on PIPs worthy actions is that they must be measurable and meaningful. PIPs are only awarded for actions that can be digitally recorded or tracked using smart phones, smart meters, quantified self apps, e-payment platforms, etc.

Furthermore, for the many products, services and organizations we include in our actions catalog, we consider whether they have been vetted by a third-party certifier, or have been compared/rated against recognized standards that were developed and are accepted by experts. As no rating system is 100 percent perfect, we conduct a literature review on products and entities to help us evaluate their positive impact.
PIPs TRACKS AND TALLIES ACTIONS AND IMPACTS
Every PIP earned and used is tracked and tallied. A customized dashboard provides a snapshot of all earn &
column2: use activity along with our community's collective impact. The dashboard is also a place for messaging around specific goals (from furniture donated and trees planted to coal fired power plants not built). You'll also learn about contests and challenges as well as community wide campaigns. In this way, we hope to up the fun and the impact of our daily actions.

column1: <div> <h3>Risks &amp
Rewards programs are popular
column2: who doesn't love their frequent flyer miles? Standing out among all these programs may be PIPs' greatest challenge.

column1: But in every challenge lies opportunity. Traditional points programs have a singular purpose - to drive loyalty and sales for one company or product. As an incentives network, PIPs is the ONE rewards program that drives loyalty and sales for multiple partners.

Similarly, most programs encouraging social good focus in on one behavior, i.e. recycling, or donating to a cause. With second mover advantage, the PIPs platform is designed for multiple action opportunities and high user utility. A low friction and entertaining user interface, augmented by game features, dynamic content and unique high quality catalogs (both EARN and USE) sets the PIPs experience apart from the others.
Other Ways To Help
PIPs is truly grateful to all who contribute to our campaign, and by that we mean not just with their dollars, but with their hearts, minds and deeds.
<ul>
<li>Spread the excitement about the PIPs Indiegogo Campaign (<span style=""background-color: initial
• Be a PIPs evangelist/a - Follow us (and share) on Twitter, Facebook and Tumblr.
Join PIPs, refer your friends and get PIP'n.
Also we value feedback. Please share your ideas with theteam@pipsrewards.com.
Thanks everybody.

column2: > Help Quercus to set a legal action to protect one of Europe's best-preserved coastline areas!

column1: Versão portuguesa

The project ""Touristic and Environmental Development of Vila Formosa” is the most recent threat to the heritage of Natural Park of Southwest Alentejo and Costa Vicentina, in Portugal, which is considered one of the Europe's best-preserved coastline areas, with unique species of wild fauna and flora.

There is a real risk of urbanization of a 55 hectares area in the municipality of Odemira, located less than 2 kilometres from the coast, involving a hotel, two touristic villages and also entertainment facilities for sport practice and thematic events. This investment will destroy the habitat of endemic species of flora and fauna, such as Ononis hackelli, a plant classified as highest conservation priority, and the Cabrera's Vole (Microtus cabrerae) habitat. It is likely to have potential impacts in the Mira River estuary as well.

This project ignores the guidelines of the Regional Strategic Territorial Plan for Alentejo Region and clearly compromises the Municipal Master Plan of Odemira. Farmlands with agricultural potential, which are part of Mira River Irrigation Area, will now be converted to urbanized area.

The environmental impact assessment was not properly made for this investment, because no alternative locations were presented, as required under the legislation, which provides the evaluation of alternatives, including the zero alternative. This is even more significant, considering that this project is being held in a classified area for biodiversity conservation.
The Natural Park Territorial Plan’s Regulation, which aims to control the construction outside urban areas to protect natural values, was also forgotten.

Moreover, the previous Government introduced a paragraph in the transitory regime of the Resolution of the Ministers Council n.º 11-B/2011, of 4th February, article 87, nº 8 (a Governmental law that created the Regulation of PNSACV), which represented an illegal and anti-constitutional measure clearly benefiting the promoters of the project, that have been trying for many years to urbanize the remaining part of this unique natural heritage.

Given the severity of environmental impacts foreseen, Quercus called to courts action to prevent this outrage, taking a legal action in order to prevent the collusion between real estate agents and public authorities.

Therefore, since March 13th, Quercus is setting a legal case against the Portuguese Ministry of Agriculture, Sea, Environment and Land Use Planning, the Council of Ministers and the Vila Formosa Project promoters, in order to appeal the courts to declare null these decisions taken by the current and previous Governments.

To cover the estimated costs of this legal action – around 5,000 Euros - Quercus has launched this crowdfunding campaign, where everyone may contribute to raise this amount. Even the smallest donations can help us keeping this fight.
The time is now to help Quercus fight this battle for the environment and the protection of our remaining natural heritage.
Your donation matters. Make a difference!
Versão portuguesa
Maps

WOW!
Thanks so much everyone for supporting! It was a great success - we exceeded our original
goal by over $500!!
We look forward to updating y'all about our
work with young people here in the Coal River Valley as the year
progresses. And to support this work going forward, please consider
donating to the RAMPS general fund.
Onwards!

UPDATE:  Thanks so much to those of you who helped us reach our original goal of $1,200! 

With only a week left for our fundraiser, we're 'RAMPing' up our target to the $2,000 stretch goal.  In the weeks since we launched this fundraiser, we have expanded this project, and opened many more possibilities for additional funding. 

We are excited that more youth have been eager to join, including some local young women!  With the increased interest and participation of Coal River youth, we have started sending multiple crews out into the mountains each weekend, with youth having the opportunity to interchange between collecting firewood and collecting medicinal roots!   We have also begun bringing some wood loads to one of our young friends currently on home confinement for him to split. 

If we are able to reach our $2,000 goal, we would be able to afford a trailer and
a heavy duty chainsaw we could use to teach more advanced timber

skills, such as milling lumber.  With the root digging aspect of our work expanding, additional funding would also support a tincture workshop for youth to prepare the medicinal roots they have dug, and so much more!

In the heart of West Virginia’s coal country, RAMPS (Radical Action for Mountains’ and People’s Survival) has been taking young people from the Coal River Valley out into the mountains to learn leadership skills and resilience.

Specifically, as part of our new Youth Empowerment Project (YEP), we go on expeditions and work with youth to identify dead trees and split them for firewood, which we then distribute to their families or sell locally--with the youth receiving a portion of the profits.

Your support can help us take this project to the next level!

We need a youth-friendly chainsaw, as well as more mauls, wedges, axes, chains, pulleys, and a budget for vehicle maintenance. (Our enthusiastic young friends tend to be very hard on tools!) If we reach our stretch goal of $2,000, we can also afford a trailer and a heavy duty chainsaw we could use to teach more advanced timber skills, such as milling lumber.

Our YEP trips aren’t restricted to gathering firewood. Outings include root-digging days in which we gather medicinal herbs, such as yellowroot (Hydrastis canadensis) and bloodroot (Sanguinaria canadensis). 

We're excited to engage local youth in ways that contribute to their understanding of the land around them. Engaging youth in activities like firewood gathering and root digging (both important parts of the cultural fabric of Appalachia) can help youth avoid the all-too-real cycles of incarceration, drug abuse, and violence that go hand in hand with life in coalfield communities.

As part of this project, RAMPS is also engaging other adults in the community to share skills, such as tree identification, with the younger generation. (Thank you, Pickle!)

We plan to keep this project going through the Fall, and hope to make it an annual effort -- and expand to year-round youth-oriented projects.

To make this project sustainable, we need your help in getting youth-friendly tools!  A donation of $10 would get a felling wedge
column2: for $35, you would provide our young friends with a splitting maul
column3:
and for those especially generous donors, $250 would purchase a smaller, quality chainsaw so youth can learn to buck felled trees and build valuable cutting skills.

Since youth are the ones who will inspire and shape the future of this community, RAMPS is dedicated to helping outfit them with tools that support self-determination and resilience. We’re asking for your help to plant these powerful seeds of new leadership and hope.

Engaging youth in activities like firewood gathering and root digging (both important parts of the cultural fabric of Appalachia) can help youth avoid the all-too-real cycles of incarceration, drug abuse, and violence that go hand in hand with life in coalfield communities.As part of this project, RAMPS is also engaging other adults in the community to share skills, such as tree identification, with the younger generation. (Thank you, Pickle!)We plan to keep this project going through the Fall, and hope to make it an annual effort -- and expand to year-round youth-oriented projects.To make this project sustainable, we need your help in getting youth-friendly tools!  A donation of $10 would get a felling wedge
column2: for $35, you would provide our young friends with a splitting maul
column3: and for those especially generous donors, $250 would purchase a smaller, quality chainsaw so youth can learn to buck felled trees and build valuable cutting skills.Since youth are the ones who will inspire and shape the future of this community, RAMPS is dedicated to helping outfit them with tools that support self-determination and resilience. We’re asking for your help to plant these powerful seeds of new leadership and hope.",4.0,0,"4 Campaigns

Fossil Fuel Divestment Convergence 2014

On the weekend of April 4–6, 2014, hundreds of students from colleges and universities across the United States and Canada will gather at San Francisco State University for the 2nd annual student-led Fossil Fuel Divestment Convergence. SFSU has been chosen because of their ideal location and the success of their divestment campaign, which is chronicled in the video above. We need more stories just like it. For our movement to replicate SFSU's and other schools' successes on a massive scale, we need the benefit of strategizing, sharing our stories, and connecting face-to-face.

We will spend the weekend strengthening our national and regional networks, as well as building organizing skills to take our divestment campaigns to the next level. We have already taken first steps towards escalation through coalition-building and direct action, gaining attention nationwide with sit-ins, petitions, rallies, public art displays, referenda, and building alumni and faculty support.

The divestment break-out meeting at Power Shift last October

At one year old, this is a crucial moment for the student divestment movement-- we have the potential to build on the explosive momentum of 2013 by coordinating student efforts to spark a wildfire of bold, escalated action. This national gathering will help cast that spark!

In order to confront the overwhelming crisis of climate change, we must not only build our organizing skills and leadership, but also nurture relationships with those fighting the same forces. Fossil fuel divestment is just one piece of taking on the fossil fuel industry, and we will continue to bind our on-campus struggles with those of the larger Climate Justice movement.

What We Need
We are using a combination of grants and grassroots fundraising to support our efforts. Expenses include:
• Travel stipends: We want this national gathering to be available to all students, regardless of travel costs. Therefore, we are working to offer travel stipends to as many students as possible.
• Speaker support: We want to offer adequate support for the powerful speakers and organizers we have invited to join us in April.

• Food, housing, space rental: As with any major gathering, there are costs for food, housing, and space rental. We are hoping to cover as many of these costs as possible for students, speakers, and trainers.

The Impact

Fossil fuel divestment marks one of the largest student movements of the last decade. With over 300 active campaigns, and more popping up every month, coming together in a national gathering space is crucial to building power together. We will have the opportunity to share skills and stories, build tighter networks, develop a vision for our national strategy in the next year, and strengthen ties with communities fighting at other fronts of the climate crisis.

Your donations will make sure students who cannot afford travel expenses on their own can make it to the convergence. Just one donation, of your capacity, will help students from New York or New Hampshire get to and from the convergence, ensuring that we can have as many colleges and states as possible represented and connected.
<div>
Student organizers at last year's convergence in a team-building workshop
Other Ways You Can Support Our Work
We know that not everyone is able to make a donation (believe us, we're students), but there are many ways to support this project:
<ul>
• Come to the Fossil Fuel Divestment Convergence!
• Spread the word using social media: @StudentsDivest and Fossil Fuel Divestment Student Network
• Please share this Indiegogo with your communities and networks
Many thanks!
-Sachie and the Fossil Fuel Divestment Convergence Planning Team

The Fossil Fuel Divestment Convergence is a collaborative project of the Fossil Fuel Divestment Student Network and California Student Sustainability Coalition, sponsored by Earth Island Institute. We are grateful for support from the Responsible Endowments Coalition, New Economy Coalition, 350.org, Energy Action Coalition, As You Sow, and many others.

GOAL Reached! THANK YOU!
Construction will begin on the database in early August and we have a target launch date of October 1st, just in time for the 2nd Annual Students for Zero Waste Conference!

Any additional funds raised will go towards maintenance on the database: updates, upgrades, and troubleshooting expenses as we continue to build this movement. Our STRETCH Goal is an additional $1,000 by August 1st.
About PLAN:

The Post-Landfill Action Network (PLAN) is a nonprofit, cooperative network of student leaders working to achieve zero waste in their campus communities. We support the implementation of practical waste-reduction initiatives, educate students about the waste crisis, and help train the next generation of leaders for the zero waste movement. Our goal is to create zero waste campuses that lead the way to a zero waste world where landfills and incinerators are obsolete.

The Project: Building a Zero Waste Campus Platform and Database

Over the past two years the PLAN team has had the privilege to work with many incredible people leading innovative zero waste projects on campuses across the country.

From the inspiration of their work we believe that a zero waste campus is possible--but it cannot be done alone! PLAN has received hundreds of resources from campuses across the country and we have seen campuses learn from each other to improve their programs and build a movement.

We want to simplify the sharing process and make it accessible to all.

With an easy to access, searchable database students can collaborate with ease.  The PLAN staff, student organizers and other leaders in zero waste can answer questions in a public forum. This searchable, crowd-sourced, zero waste database will create the foundation for successful campaigns.

There is no need for campuses to reinvent the wheel!

The platform will provide the following basic functions:

1.  A collaborative discussion board broken up into specific projects and programs. Through this discussion board any individual (students, admin, etc) can create a free account to access and participate in the conversations, and upload/download resources at any time.

2.  Documents will be uploadable and downloadable for free.

3.  All discussion boards and uploads will be tagged with searchable keywords (ex: “composting”, or “procurement policies”) which will organize content in a navigable library.

Perks:

We will email you information on how to redeem your Yerdle Reuse Dollars after you donate!
Here is the campaign sticker you will receive:
Supporters:
We will update this page with new supporters each week!

<b>Hi!
Thanks for looking at my campaign to go to Taiwan in search of new, highly remote populations
of Rhododendron pachysanthum, one of the most
visually stunning species in all of Asia!
My name is Rama Lopez-Rivera. I'm a plant hunter who is absolutely passionate about the plants of temperate Asia, their conservation and continued survival under the pressure of a changing world.

The focus of this campaign is to raise funds for my trek deep into the mountains of Taiwan, to identify 2 to 3 new populations of the stunning and endangered Rhododendron pachysanthum, an IUCN Red List species.

As yet, there is only one confirmed and verified location for this species on the lofty 3740m summit of Mt Nanhu in the centre of Taiwan (where I took all of these images!). Other publications (including the Rhododendron Red List) place this as the only known location and all conservation efforts and data is based on this information. I suspected there were others!

While combing through herbariums in Taiwan (a kind of scientific depository of pressed and dried plants), looking at Rhododendrons in general, I soon started to find old misnamed specimen sheets that I believed to be identical to Rhododendron pachysanthum, but all were from other very remote mountain ranges, nowhere near Mt Nanhu.

Investigating further, after being left a little confused as to why these suspected populations had not come to light, I was able to narrow them down to three isolated mountains that had been mostly cut off from the outside world by severe earthquake damage over 30 years ago. One of these mountains was only visited for the first time by a group of hikers in 2013 - BINGO!

I plan to leave for Taiwan in October to begin what promises to be an epic journey into the unknown. To have any chance of reaching these isolated locations, I need to hire a vehicle, driver and a guide for the trek into the mountains, so that I can locate the Rhododendrons and complete a survey on their health, size, condition and suitability for introduction to cultivation.  I am self funded and do these trips on a shoestring. For this trip however, I really do need your help - every pound will not only be highly appreciated, but absolutely key to the success of the trip. I have estimated ten days of hiking through remote leech &
column2: snake infested terrain to complete the expedition - I can't wait!

column1: WHAT THE EXPEDITION NEEDS!
Guide Cost: £100 per day x 10 days = £1000 (includes all guides personal provisions for expedition).
<strong>

Thats me in the photo above, amongst a group of Rhododendron pachysanthum on Mt Nanhu. The little woman next to me is my guide Tt! When I was introduced to her shortly before my first ascent of Mt Nanhu, I remember thinking ""thats my guide, she's tiny?!"". I quickly learnt total respect for her sheer toughness and real sixth sense for finding her way through the wilderness. She has since joined me on every trip I have made to Nanhu. She knows this Rhododendron well and understands my objectives. She has been instrumental in helping me organise this trip, but it's going to be a tough expedition in remote mountains meaning her daily fee is well worth the investment for the success of this campaign.
Vehicle Hire: £500 for car and driver for pick up and drop off.

This is essential for getting myself, my guide and equipment from Taipei, Taiwan's capital city in the North down to the Central East coast county of Hualien for our trek into the mountains. The driver will return after ten days to collect us on our return for the journey back to Taipei.
Contingency Fund: £500 for unforseen circumstances.

Travelling in the Taiwanese backcountry is a dangerous business. With the ever present hazard of typhoons and landslides, it may be necessary to delay elements of the trip or backtrack to find safer routes etc. This may involve staying extra nights in hotels, or changes for the driver. It is important to have these extra funds at hand.. Just in case!
Total Estimated Cost = £2000

I will be paying all other costs such as flights and equipment out of my own savings. I just can't make the extra costs of the guide, driver and contingency fund. Your assistance, no matter how small will honestly make a monumental difference for me and the project!
THE EXPEDITION IMPACT:

I have an excellent track record in plant exploration having organised several expeditions to China, Japan, Taiwan and United States. I have published articles about my work in several scientific and professional journals. I also lecture on the subject of temperate plant exploration with an emphasis on East Asian flora.
If confirmed that these are indeed new populations of Rhododendron pachysanthum, outside of their known range, it will do three things:

1, Allow current information on the species to be updated in current and future publications, such as the IUCN Red List and hopefully enable longterm monitoring to take place. This would also aid in conserving this fine species for the future.
2, Assess the suitability for their introduction into cultivation in botanical gardens, thus ensuring their study and future survival.
3, Publish my findings from the expedition to further our understanding of the Rhododendron species on this fantastically diverse island -Taiwan.

Short Summary

The Himalayas are a relatively young mountain range with a fragile geology prone to landslides. The deluge on 17 June destroyed towns, villages, roads and bridges for more than 60 miles along the banks of the Mandakini and the Alaknanda, two important tributaries of the Ganges river.
From 14 to 17 June 2013, the Indian state of Uttarakhand and adjoining area received heavy rainfall, which was about 375 percent more than the benchmark rainfall during a normal monsoon.
Out little donation could help them in reinforcing their life back to normal track. This is a big job, and it will be a marathon, not a sprint!
So, I request to please donate and help the children who have lost their parents, parents who have lost their familty and all the people who have suffered badly.
Get the more information about the disaster in the wiki link mentioned below
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_North_India_f...
Please write a comments about your contribution.
The fund wil be transferred to them by the Baidyanath foundation - a charitable trust having 80G, registered under FCRA ,Govt. of India
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please forward to your friends circle and raise fund as much and possible.
Out little help could change their life.

start up a high visibility social impact co op !
managed by all women waste workers (kabadi)
this project is a collaborative with AIKMM (ALL INDIA UNION OF RAG PICKERS) FOR THE DELHI REGION

If successful, this campaign will have an amazing impact on the cultural perspectives that the Delhi population will have about the valuable services now provided by the Kabadis which are currently being ignored. At the heart of the problem, local city government wants to privatize waste and introduce mechanization and incineration technology which would in fact do away with a working population of 300,000 people now manually doing the waste picking. To explore this issue further, I suggest viewing the Vimeo video DELHI WASTE WARS by EJOLT an international environmental group,.
http://www.vimeo.com/32400188

As a contribution gift, you will receive ALL HAND MADE HAND PICKED AND GUTTER PROOF FLOWERS (see images in the gallery) and descriptions in the perks....these same flowers which I will train the all women co-op to create. I emphasize the genuine origin of these gifts because under the pretense of UPCYCLING  and fair trade items there are in fact many fake gadgets out there
and the women and children who may be assembling these toys etc. do not receive any of the benefits claimed!
Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you could forward this campaign appeal
In conclusion, it is my hope and goal to have the co-op up and running in 2013. All contributors will receive progress documentation as the plan will include extensive filming of the project.

Thank you for the consideration and may the Kabadi continue on!

Help us put the bearded vultures on the move

Hi, my name is Alex Llopis Dell, I work at the Vulture Conservation Foundation, and I am the coordinator of the Bearded vulture European Endangered Species Programme (EEP). I am responsible for the captive breeding network for the Bearded vulture, which is crucial for providing young birds to be released into the wild in 5 different European regions right now.
We urgently need your help to assist with the transport of 19 bearded vultures across Europe, and make sure the reintroduction of the Bearded vulture is a long term success.

In Europe, in what is known as one of the most successful stories of a species recovery from extinction, bearded vultures have been reintroduced into the wild since 1986. This initiative, which is led by the VCF, has enabled the release of more than 300 young birds to the Alps, Cazorla (Andalusia, Spain), Massif Central (France), Corsica (France) and, more recently, Maestrazgo (Valencia, Spain).

DEUTCH: Wir brauchen dringend Eure Hilfe um 19 Bartgeier quer durch Europa zu transportieren. Diese Bartgeier sind Teil vom Bartgeier-Zuchtprogramm und brauchen medizinische Hilfe, einen Partner oder einen sicheren Ort wo sie vor Krankheiten sicher sind. Nur dank dem Zuchtprogramm können wir Bartgeier in den Alpen, dem Zentralmassiv und auf Korsika in Frankreich sowie in Andalusien und Maestrazgo, Spanien auswildern und so diesen eindrücklichen Segler zurückbringen.

FRANÇAIS: Nous avons un besoin urgent de votre aide pour transporter 19 gypaètes barbus à travers l'Europe. Ces gypaètes barbus font partie du programme d'élevage des gypaètes barbus et ont besoin d'aide médicale, d'un partenaire ou d'un endroit sûr où ils sont à Iaise pour échapper aux maladies. Ce n'est que grâce au programme d'élevage que nous pouvons relâcher des gypaètes barbus dans les Alpes, le Massif Central et la Corse en France ainsi qu'en Andalousie et au Maestrazgo en Espagne et ainsi faire revenir cet impressionnant marin.

column2: >Hike to the release site in the Swiss Alps (Hansruedi Weyrich)

column1: So, if things are going so well, why do we need your help?

We are currently increasing the number of reintroduction areas, to make sure it is a success in the long term, so yearly we need to make sure we have more captive bred young to release into the wild! This means we need some of the birds to find a suitable partner in the captive breeding network. And let me tell you, the bearded vultures have very strong personalities and they do not get along with any bird!

The success of the bearded vulture EEP depends on successful pairing of birds, good networking of partners, and attention to every detail of each individual bird, with the final goal of increasing the number of birds to release to the wild.

Recently, there have been outbreaks of the West Nile virus, a disease carried by mosquitoes, which caused a few deaths of Bearded vultures within the EEP. We need to move some of these birds to centres at higher altitude and colder climate, where the mosquitoes cannot survive and the vultures can be safe of the West Nile virus.
Finally, one of the birds has some health issues and needs careful veterinary assistance at a more specialized centre.
Safe and fast transport for the birds is crucial!

Your support is critical for us to be able to provide safe and quick transport for these birds. Some of them will be travelling by plane, others by car, and we need your help to secure these transports. Plane transports cost around 1000 euros for each bird, car transports are a bit cheaper (around 300 - 500 euros), but sometimes they require more time, a lot of km on the road, and so we are planning a few stops, feeding the birds when needed along the way, to make sure the birds are stress free and comfortable on the move. Finally we have to make sure we have all the paper work which is legally needed to transport wildlife.
All in all, we need a total of 7.500 euros to transport the 19 birds, which includes car and plane transport costs between zoos and specialized breeding centres.

The technical work of captive breeding network and the bird releases are funded by us, partner zoos and several different funders and projects, but these bird transfers are not covered by our current budget at the VCF. That is why we decided to launch an urgent crowdfunding campaign.
Our Bearded vulture gifts to you

To thank you for your support, we have prepared some exclusive gifts, which allow us to share our passion for bearded vultures with all of you. Some of these include printed photographs of the bearded vultures by Hansruedi Weyrich, others feature a funny bearded vulture caricature by Green Humour, and we are even offering a personal guided tour to one of our specialized captive breeding centres at Lleida, Spain, or at Haringsee, Austria, to see these amazing birds and get to know us and our work in person!
Every donation is important for us, as a non-profit organization, and we will put your name on our donors list on our webpage and on our annual review.
Who are these 19 bearded vultures? And where are they going exactly?
1. Meet BG 977 male (2018) and BG 1007 female (2018). They are meeting for the first time this year, and hopefully they will get along and form a new pair

BG 977 was born at Vallcalent on 31/01/2018, from first-time parents BG 297 x BG 115. They had never been successful breeding before, so we were monitoring them closely. What we discovered was that the female had a slight limp on one leg and was not able to prepare a good nest bowl for the eggs. Thus the eggs were constantly rolling all over the nest and many were found broken.
This year, we decided to intervene, and removed 3 eggs from the nest, to make sure they would not break. From these 3 eggs, 2 chicks hatched, including BG 977, who was the first to hatch, and was then adopted and reared successfully by an imprinted male. Because he is imprinted, he is not able to pair with another bird, but this successful male has reared other birds' chicks by himself!

BG 1007 was the last chick to hatch this year within the EEP on 23/04/2018 at Richard Faust Centre (RFZ), Austria. She hatched in the incubator, with assistance, and was then adopted by her own parents. Her parents were able to breed twice this year! This is the first time a single breeding pair has produced two clutches in one year, the first and last juveniles of the breeding season.

About the transfer
BG 977 male 
When: October 2018
From: Vallcalent, Lleida, Spain  To: Riga Zoo, Latvia
How: by car from Vallcalent to Barcelona + by plane from Barcelona to RFZ, Austria + by car to the Riga Zoo, Latvia

BG 1007 female 
When: October 2018
From: RFZ, Haringsee, Austria   To: Riga Zoo, Latvia
How: by car to the Riga Zoo, Latvia
2. Meet BG 327 male (1999) and BG 381 female (2001). They are looking for a new home and maybe a different partner, because it’s really not working between them...

BG 327 male hatched at RFZ, Austria, on 07/03/1999. His mother was the last existing bird from the Balkans Peninsula (in and ex situ), who died on 29/08/2010. BG 327 is one of 4 live descendants from this important female. So a sort of VIP bird in the EEP.

BG 381 female hatched at Almaty zoo, Kazakhstan, on 01/03/2001. She is thought to have been at least partially hand-reared. In 2002 she was transferred to Riga zoo and started to breed in 2011, laying her first egg, but was never successful in her attempts.
The bearded vulture pair has not been successful in breeding for the past years and has laid infertile eggs, so they both are moving to the specialized captive breeding centre at Vallcalent, to try to find a solution.

About the transfer
When: Mid to end October
From: Riga zoo, Latvia   To: Vallcalent, Spain.
How: by car with the Riga zoo staff to RFZ centre, Austria + by car to the Asters centre, Sallanches, France + by car to Vallcalent, Spain.
3. Meet BG 080 male (1985) and BG 212 male (1994). They are swapping homes to hopefully find new partners

BG 080 was born at Innsbruck zoo, Austria, on 03/03/1985. He is an old experienced bird, which has bred at Hannover zoo with success from 1991 to 2013. When the female died, he was transferred to RFZ, Austria and is now a good foster parent. We know that Bearded vulture males are fertile until the end of their lives, so we would like to find him a new suitable partner at the La Garenne zoo, Switzerland.

BG 212 was born at Tierpark Friedrichsfelde, Berlin, Germany, on 28/02/1994. Until September 2012 was determined as a female and unfortunately was not able to mate with other males, between 1994 and 2012. Interestingly enough, the pair was frequently observed bonding and building a nest, but of course they never laid an egg. When the second male died in 2012, sex determination was repeated and we found out he was a male!
At Puy du Fou, France, he was finally paired with a female! But the male was never able to successfully mate. We tried with a different female at La Garenne zoo, Switzerland, but again, it did not work. Finally, it has been decided to use the bird as a foster parent, with an older female.

4. Meet GypHelp BG 973 male (2017). He has some feather problems and is going on a social trip to hopefully start feeling better.

On 26/07/2018, the team from Asters, monitoring the wild bearded vulture breeding pairs, found a young chick at Bargy nord. Probably he flew from the nest, but was now unable to fly again. His parents were feeding him regularly, but after one month the team could see that he was still not able to fly, so he was transferred to the Tichodrome recovery centre to find out what the problem was and help the bird.
A feather abnormality was identified, which could be of genetic origin, and we need to transfer him to Guadalentín Specialized Breeding Centre (Cazorla, Spain) to give him the opportunity to have social contact with other birds. We would like to put it together with Rin Ran, a wild bearded vulture female which fell from the nest and had to go through eye surgery recently. In Guadalentín staff will continue to observe his moult process.

About the transfer
When: end September
From: Asters specialized captive breeding centre, Sallanches, France
To: Guadalentín specialized captive breeding centre, Cazorla, Spain
How: by car to Vallcalent (Spain) + by carrier transport to Guadalentín
5. Meet BG 727 male (2017), he is on the move to be a chaperon to a lone female at the Goldau zoo

This imprinted bird was hand-reared by a private collector, and is now at Pairi Daiza, in Belgium. He will now travel to Goldau zoo (Switzerland) to keep a lone female company until 2019. The female lost her mate and it is important she has company until the next breeding season, while we find a suitable new partner for her. When a new breeding male is found, the chaperon will be transferred to the RFZ center, Austria, by car after next breeding season (2019).

From: Pairi Daiza, Belgium   To: Goldau Zoo, Switzerland

6. Meet BG 398 female (2002). She needs artificial incubation for her eggs, so she needs to be at a specialized breeding centre

Born in Almaty zoo, on 13/03/2002, this female was hand-reared by humans. This has resulted in the need to always remove the eggs after being laid, because she is not capable of incubating the eggs and rearing the chicks. She is now at a German private collection. At Richard Faust Zentrum Specialized Breeding Centre, Austria, this female will be paired with another male and specialized artificial incubation is available.

From: Germany   To: Richard Faust Zentrum Specialized Breeding Centre, Austria

7. Meet BG 726 (founder female, 2008?). She is looking for a new partner and she probably also needs artificial incubation for her eggs

Possibly born in 2008, in an unknown place, this female arrived at the Yerevan Zoo, Armenia, on 05/04/2008. We do not know if she was hand-reared. She was later sold to the Nikolaev zoo, where she lives now.
Being a female, if all goes well and we find a suitable partner for her, there is a chance that the new pair produces important descendants for the EEP.

8. Meet BG 844 (2015) and BG 673 (2011). They are a breeding pair looking for a new home in Ukraine

BG 844 male, born at Guadalentín, Spain, on the 26/02/2015. He is a descendant from a very successful breeding pair (16 fledglings in 10 breeding seasons!). Most of them have been released in different reintroduction projects. He is a sibling from the the wild breeding sibling pair Hortelano x Marchena, from Andalusia. He is now at the Richard Faust Zentrum Specialized Breeding Centre, Austria.

BG 673 female, also born at Guadalentín, on the 21/03/2011. She is a descendant from a second very successful breeding pair (14 fledglings in 11 breeding seasons!). Most of them have been also released in different reintroduction projects. She is a sibling from the successful Andalusia wild breeding female Blimunda. She is now at the Richard Faust Zentrum Specialized Breeding Centre, Austria.
This pair will be transferred to Nikolaev zoo, in exchange for founder birds, and to establish a breeding pair there.

These 3 siblings are all descendants from a founder pair. Genetically they are important for the EEP and they will be added to the captive breeding stock, and form 3 breeding pairs, when they reach sexual maturity.

11. Meet BG 1006 male (2018) and BG 911 female (2016). They are important birds, descendants of founder birds. They are moving to a centre at a higher altitude to keep them safe from the West Nile Virus

BG 1006 is a male descendant from a new founder male housed at RFZ, Austria. This is an important bird in the EEP. Born on the 06/04/2018, Last year his sibling died due to West Nile Virus, so it is urgent to transfer it to a secure breeding center.

BG 911 female is the first descendant from a new founder female housed at Tallinn zoo. Born on the 23/03/2016, she was transferred by car to RFZ for adoption. She is also being transferred to Guadalentín to assure no West Nile Virus presence and free of aspergillosis infection.

The whole picture – the story of the bearded vulture reintroduction project (1975-2018)

The reintroduction of the bearded vulture into Europe is one of the world´s greatest wildlife comeback stories of all times, and an ongoing project and adventure that continues to gather stakeholders, members of the public, and general interest, all around. From near extinction in Europe we have managed, in a few decades, to bring back the species to the Alps and Andalusia, and are continuing to work towards restoring the species across the continent.

Bearded vultures were once widely distributed across Eurasia and Africa, with significant populations in most of the main mountain ranges in these continents. The species used to breed in almost all of Europe, from Spain to the Balkans, passing through the Pyrenees and the Alps. This ensured a constant genetic exchange and kept a healthy European meta-population. However, this situation rapidly changed during the 19th century and by the beginning of the last century the species was almost entirely wiped out. Only three populations survived in Western Europe, two small island groups in Corsica and Crete, and the main one in the Pyrenees, none of them self-sustaining without specific actions, and certainly not in large-enough numbers to re-colonize its former distribution range. In these situations, reintroductions seem to be the only viable way of recovering such highly damaged meta-populations.

In 1978, the idea of bringing back the bearded vulture to the Alps started to take form, and the first releases into the wild took place almost a decade later, in 1986. The time in between was used to set up the basis of a coordinated international programme, developed with the intention of establishing a long-lasting and captive-breeding network that would produce offspring for future reintroductions. This concept, which was rather novel at the time, would be used in other breeding plans aimed for conservation, and was also instrumental in the establishment of the European Association of Zoos and Aquaria (EAZA) European Endangered Species Programme (EEP). The bearded vulture breeding programme was thus one of the first EEPs to be accepted and implemented.

The Bearded Vulture EEP nowadays is composed of a network of 42 institutions mainly distributed across Europe, comprising 35 zoos, 3 large (red) and 2 small (green) specialized captive-breeding centres, and 3 private keepers, which in total keep and breed 174 bearded vultures for conservation purposes. This network is managed by the VCF, which also owns 80% of the captive bearded vultures. All partners follow and respect the best practice guidelines for captive-breeding bearded vultures developed over the years.

The goal of this international captive breeding program (EEP) is the conservation in situ of the species, using the produced nestlings as a base basis for reintroduction projects approved by the VCF/EEP. And the VCF’s final goal is to restore the species across its former range in Europe and establish a European Bearded Vulture meta-population, connecting the current extant isolated populations (Pyrenees, Corsica and Crete) with the reintroduced populations (The Alps, The Massif Central, Andalusia, in a continuum that extends from northern Africa (Morocco) to Asia (Turkey &

Our strength is our network and strategy

The Bearded vulture European Endangered Species Programme (EEP) is an International captive breeding program which started in 1978. This program is composed by a large number of different types of institutions: private and municipal Zoos, private collectors, NGO’s, and Governmental recovery centers.
The Vulture Conservation Foundation is the leading partner of this group, gives technical support to all organizations, defines the strategy and the guidelines of the EEP.

Since the beginning the objectives of this programme were clear and are still valid today:
-    to create and maintain a captive stock as a genetic reserve for the species
-    to produce chicks which are able to reproduce as they reach adult age 
-    to establish a wild population, capable to survive and reproduce independently of human intervention.

Finally, with the VCF working at an European scale, the ultimate aim of the programme is to establish an European meta-population of Bearded Vultures, creating gene flow between the existing isolated autochthonous populations in Europe, linking the Alps, the Pyrenees, Corsica, and Crete to the populations in North Africa and Asia.
My main task as coordinator of the BV EEP is to achieve this established final goal: to create a European meta-population of Bearded Vultures.

To reach this final goal it is necessary to assure the continuity of this captive breeding network and to provide young birds for all running reintroduction projects. We have not only to provide a certain number of chicks per year, we have also to provide the adequate birds for creating a human independent and self-sustainable wild population.

This requires a meticulous planning of pairing of birds and pair distribution inside the EEP, as well as adequately selecting the right nestling for each reintroduction project, following criteria on sex ratio and genetics.

Finally, to make sure that we are fomenting the development of natural behaviour in captive bred birds, we make sure all bearded vulture chicks are natural reared, with absolutely no human intervention in feeding or caring. This is done by adult birds only, either the parents of the chick or adoptive/foster parents.

Thanks to all this work it was possible to increase the captive breeding network step by step and consequently the yearly number of produced chicks, making it possible to start new reintroduction projects.

The key factor of all these successes is to know that pair formation in Bearded Vultures can be complicated and dangerous. That is why it was decided to create a distinction between centres dedicated exclusively to breeding (zoos and private centres) and centres dedicated to breeding and pair formation (Specialized Breeding Centres: SBCs). The role of the first is to house already established pairs and to breed the maximum number of offspring from them, while the specialized centers have specialized staff and are responsible for establishing new pairs, taking in new founders (injured birds from the wild), adopting chicks, housing problematic birds, and creating a genetic reserve by receiving specimens from all of the genetic lineages that make up the EEP.

Additionally a new technical assistance support service was created in 2013, giving all the partners the possibility to request the visit of a specialist on captive breeding of this species to receive suggestions on how to improve the facilities where their Bearded vultures are housed and consequently reduce the mortality of birds and increase breeding success at the zoos. More than half of the zoos have been visited by us during the last 5 years and have improved the aviary following our advice, showing a significantly increase of the average age of death of the birds.

All this effort made by all these partners makes possible that from an initial 40 birds, the captive population now has 174 birds, and a total yearly average production of around 25 chicks, assuring the continuity of all on-going reintroduction projects.
Risks and challenges

If we do not reach the fundraising goal, we will need to postpone some of the transports to another year, and still go through to the most urgent transports, namely the transfer of birds which need protection from disease.
If we exceed our initial fundraising goal, additional funds will go towards the building of new aviaries and improvement of current facilities at the Vallcalent Specialized Breeding Centre.
We hope you join us on this journey to bring the bearded vulture back to the European skies, from Western Spain to the Balkans!

","Help us put the bearded vultures on the move

Hi, my name is Alex Llopis Dell, I work at the Vulture Conservation Foundation, and I am the coordinator of the Bearded vulture European Endangered Species Programme (EEP). I am responsible for the captive breeding network for the Bearded vulture, which is crucial for providing young birds to be released into the wild in 5 different European regions right now.
We urgently need your help to assist with the transport of 19 bearded vultures across Europe, and make sure the reintroduction of the Bearded vulture is a long term success.

In Europe, in what is known as one of the most successful stories of a species recovery from extinction, bearded vultures have been reintroduced into the wild since 1986. This initiative, which is led by the VCF, has enabled the release of more than 300 young birds to the Alps, Cazorla (Andalusia, Spain), Massif Central (France), Corsica (France) and, more recently, Maestrazgo (Valencia, Spain).

DEUTCH: Wir brauchen dringend Eure Hilfe um 19 Bartgeier quer durch Europa zu transportieren. Diese Bartgeier sind Teil vom Bartgeier-Zuchtprogramm und brauchen medizinische Hilfe, einen Partner oder einen sicheren Ort wo sie vor Krankheiten sicher sind. Nur dank dem Zuchtprogramm können wir Bartgeier in den Alpen, dem Zentralmassiv und auf Korsika in Frankreich sowie in Andalusien und Maestrazgo, Spanien auswildern und so diesen eindrücklichen Segler zurückbringen.

FRANÇAIS: Nous avons un besoin urgent de votre aide pour transporter 19 gypaètes barbus à travers l'Europe. Ces gypaètes barbus font partie du programme d'élevage des gypaètes barbus et ont besoin d'aide médicale, d'un partenaire ou d'un endroit sûr où ils sont à Iaise pour échapper aux maladies. Ce n'est que grâce au programme d'élevage que nous pouvons relâcher des gypaètes barbus dans les Alpes, le Massif Central et la Corse en France ainsi qu'en Andalousie et au Maestrazgo en Espagne et ainsi faire revenir cet impressionnant marin.
